descript.abstract: Estimates of gross primary productivity, ecosystem respiration, and gas exchange coefficients for 356 streams and rivers across the continental United States. This data set contains the following parameters (defined below): site_name, nwis_id, nhdplus_id, long_name, lat, lon, coord_datum, alt, alt_datum, site_type, dvqcoefs.c, dvqcoefs.f, dvqcoefs.a, dvqcoefs.b, dvqcoefs.k, dvqcoefs.m, struct.canal_flag, struct.dam_flag, struct.npdes_flag, .
descript.purpose: To bring metabolism data to the world!

place.placekt: Department of Commerce, 1995, Countries, Dependencies, Areas of Special Sovereignty, and Their Principal Administrative Divisions, Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS) 10-4, Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology

U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the outlying areas of the United States, and associated areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D. C., NIST

idinfo.useconst: None, but see Distribution Liability below. Users are advised to read the associated publication thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.

cntperp.cntorg: U.S. Geological SurveyEcologist, Data Science Branch, Integrated Information Dissemination Division, U.S. Geological Survey

idinfo.datacred: This work was funded by the USGS Powell Center (Working Group title: "Continental-scale overview of stream primary productivity, its links to water quality, and consequences for aquatic carbon biogeochemistry"). Additional financial support came from the USGS NAWQA program and Office of Water Information. NSF grants DEB-1146283 and EF1442501 partially supported ROH. The USGS Wisconsin Modeling Center provided access to the HTCondor cluster for generating metabolism estimates.
idinfo.native: stuff on mac things on pc, R versions etc

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

horizpa.horizpar: A formal accuracy assessment of the horizontal positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

vertacc.vertaccr: A formal accuracy assessment of the vertical positional information in the dataset was not conducted.

procstep.procdesc: data were pulled or synthesized from existing etc...

enttyp.enttypl: Site information for river metabolism estimates
enttyp.enttypd: Information about sites at which water quality was monitored and metabolism was estimated.

attr.attrdef: Unique site identifiers for this dataset, formed by prefixing nwis_id (next attribute) with 'nwis_'
Site number in National Water Information System
attr.attrdefs: National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey, https://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/faq/sites/do-station-numbers-have-any-particular-meaning

attr.attrdef: Common identifier (ComID) of the stream reach containing the monitoring site

attr.attrdefs: National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey

attr.attrdef: Coordinate datum for lat and lon
attr.attrdefs: Coordinate Datum Codes (dec_coord_datum_cd or coord_datum_cd), National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey, https://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/coord_datum_cd
National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey, https://waterdata.usgs.gov/usa/nwis/current?submitted_form=introduction
Altitude Datum Codes (alt_datum_cd), National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey, https://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/code/alt_datum_cd_query?fmt=html

attr.attrdef: Type of water body at monitoring site
attr.attrdefs: Site Type Codes (site_tp_cd), National Water Information System, United States Geological Survey, https://help.waterdata.usgs.gov/site_tp_cd

attr.attrdef: Empirical coefficient, c, of depth estimation equation, where depth=cQ^f
Empirical coefficient, f, of depth estimation equation, where depth=cQ^f
Empirical coefficient, a, of width estimation equation, where width=aQ^b
Empirical coefficient, b, of width estimation equation, where width=aQ^b
Empirical coefficient, k, of velocity estimation equation, where velocity=kQ^m
Empirical coefficient, m, of velocity estimation equation, where velocity=kQ^m

Flag for presence of NHDPlusV2-identified canal or ditch upstream of probe location. 95: nearest canal or ditch is beyond the 95th quantile of daily average distances to 95% oxygen turnover. 80: nearest canal or ditch is beyond the 80th quantile of daily average distances to 80% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 95). 50: nearest canal or ditch is beyond the 50th quantile of daily average distances to 50% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 80). 0: nearest canal or ditch is closer than the distance represented by 50.

Flag for presence of dam upstream of probe location. 95: nearest dam is beyond the 95th quantile of daily average distances to 95% oxygen turnover. 80: nearest dam is beyond the 80th quantile of daily average distances to 80% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 95). 50: nearest dam is beyond the 50th quantile of daily average distances to 50% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 80). 0: nearest dam is closer than the distance represented by 50.

Flag for presence of NPDES point discharge upstream of probe location. 95: nearest NPDES point is beyond the 95th quantile of daily average distances to 95% oxygen turnover. 80: nearest NPDES point is beyond the 80th quantile of daily average distances to 80% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 95). 50: nearest NPDES point is beyond the 50th quantile of daily average distances to 50% oxygen turnover (and closer than the distance represented by 80). 0: nearest NPDES point is closer than the distance represented by 50.

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: This information is preliminary or provisional and is subject to revision. It is being provided to meet the need for timely best science. The information has not received final approval by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) and is provided on the condition that neither the USGS nor the U.S. Government shall be held liable for any damages resulting from the authorized or unauthorized use of the information.

cntinfo.cntpos: Chief, Data Science Branch, Integrated Information Dissemination Division, U.S. Geological Survey
